wikipedia_page.main:
Edward Adderley Stopford (1810–1874) was an Irish Anglican priest.The son of Edward Stopford, Bishop of Meath from 1842 to 1850, he was educated at Trinity College, Dublin. He held incumbencies at Caledon and Kells. He was Archdeacon of Meath from 1844; and Vicar general of Meath from 1848: holding both offices until his death.
His wife Anne died on 13 June 1891. Their daughter Alice Stopford Green was an Irish historian.

response: Brunton married Louisa Jane, daughter of Edward Stopford, Archdeacon of Meath, in 1879. She died in 1909. Lauder Brunton later converted to Islam and took up the name Jalaluddin Lauder Brunton.
